noun.description: A member of a North American people of the Creek confederacy, noted for resistance in the 19th century to encroachment on their land in Georgia and Florida. Many were resettled in Oklahoma.
Either of the Muskogean languages, usually Creek, spoken by the Seminole.

adjective.description: Relating to the Seminole or their language.

origin: Via Creek from American Spanish cimarrón wild, untamed.
